caption.title: Key epidemiological parameters estimated in this study from longitudinal swab data on third generation cephalosporin-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae sensu lato from a neotatal intensive care unit from a Children’s Hospital in Cambodia.

tr.td: Daily risk of acquisition for neonates
Force of infection from one colonised infant
Negatives following a positive swab Beta conjugate prior
All positives are false negatives Beta(1,7) prior
Negatives following a positive swab Beta conjugate prior
Three consecutive negatives are a true decolonisation Beta(1,7) prior

fn.p: * Interquartile range (IQR) taken from distribution of daily risk of acquisition (Figure 2B). † Credible interval (CrI). ‡ Inverse rate of decay of environmental contamination, as estimated in transmission model 3, multiplied by ln(2). § 95% of simulated values fell within this interval.
